intro: Barclaya wellyi, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. Barclaya wellyi is adapted to hot, dry environments and has a deep root system to access water from deeper soil layers. Its structure and growth habits make it well-suited for survival in harsh desert conditions.
